intro: Tagetes punctata, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its bright orange to yellow flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Its flowers are often used in traditional medicine and as a natural pest repellent due to their strong scent. Tagetes punctata is also a popular ornamental plant in gardens for its vibrant blooms and ease of cultivation.
